L.NAME: Konni Burton
L.TITLE: State Sen.
L.QUOTE: Religion, it gives you what's right and wrong.

L.NAME: Donna Campbell
L.TITLE: State Sen.
L.QUOTE: Animals do not kill their young, but America does?
L.Alt_Quote: I believe any society that does not respect life is destined for failure. God creates life. He means for us to sustain it until natural death.

L.NAME: Glenn Hegar
L.TITLE: Comptroller
L.QUOTE: It's not something that I try to wear on my shoulder every single day, kind of as a marker for everything that I do.

L.NAME: Matt Krause
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: You have to have the right to protect yourself against a tyrant or a government that might seek to oppress you.

L.NAME: Eddie Lucio III
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: None of us want unwanted pregnancies... we need to be realistic in the conversations we need to be having with children.
L.Alt_Quote: Sometimes those who have very strong religious convictions and go to church every day don't even talk about safe sex and other realities.

L.NAME: Eddie Lucio Jr.
L.TITLE: State Sen.
L.QUOTE: I can't prejudge why those thing happen, heinous crimes, but all I can say is that, even those that kill should not be killed.

L.NAME: Sid Miller
L.TITLE: Agriculture Commissioner
L.QUOTE: Where you stand on the life issue I think tells about your character, tells you where your heart is.

L.NAME: Elliott Naishtat
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: Health, human services, welfare — what tzedakah and tikkun olam are all about, that's what I focus on.

L.NAME: Poncho Nevárez
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: I don't see how wearing your gun outside your belt will make you more faith-driven or prosperous.

L.NAME: Dan Patrick
L.TITLE: Lt. Governor
L.QUOTE: People who believe that values and principles and the word of God has been pushed aside in schools, I understand their concern.

L.NAME: Charles Perry
L.TITLE: State Sen.
L.QUOTE: Does that reach the level of joy that I get as a heterosexual under the confines of what God ordained? I wouldn't think so.

L.NAME: Jonathan Stickland
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: It's been pretty hypocritical of a lot of 'pro-gun' people that someone commits a felony... we send them back into society, but we say, 'You now don't have the right to defend yourself.'

L.NAME: Sylvester Turner
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: I can't see a kid that's in need and walk on the other side... My obligation is to assist you.
L.Alt_Quote: I can't see a kid that's in need and walk on the other side. And I can't treat a kid as if, you're not my biological kid so I don't have to do anything for you. My obligation is to assist you.

L.NAME: Kirk Watson
L.TITLE: State Sen.
L.QUOTE: I don't accept the inability of others to recognize that people can love one another... that they can be married in a union that's as powerful as a male-female union.

L.NAME: Bill Zedler
L.TITLE: State Rep.
L.QUOTE: Once you start redefining marriage based on whether they love each other... you open up the gate to everything.
L.Alt_Quote: Fundamentally what it boils down to is an attack on the family.

COPY.Lawmaker_Text: During and after the 2015 legislative session, The Texas Tribune invited numerous legislators and state officials to discuss how God and faith influenced their decisions and debates. Below are key excerpts from the 23 who agreed to be interviewed. Their full remarks can be found here.
COPY.About_Text:
The God & Governing project emerged during the 2015 session of the Texas Legislature, as it became evident that discussions of God and faith were underscoring a greater share of political discourse — and disagreement — than in the recent past. The Tribune invited lawmakers to discuss how faith influenced their public policy decisions.

ADD PARTNERSHIP LINE
COPY.Related_Text: More thoughts from lawmakers on this topic.
COPY.Tagline: A documentary series on how Texas legislators' religious beliefs guide their lawmaking
